author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Of sport that groweth quick, and bold men cheer,
To scale the mount, whilst running fifty mile,
A task most wondrous, challeng'd without fear,
The thrill of feat, unquench'd by sweat or toil.

A noble quiz in April ye shall find,
An amiable draught I do propose,
Some knowledge sweet that flows like vintage wine,
The challenge rich as rich the laughter flows,

Unbound from cities, fleeing cost so high,
Come pilgrims, still, yet laden with lustration,
Divine their lot, yet writhe in inflation's pry,
Effaced like foamy ale's libation.

feedItems.title: The Fast-Growing Sport Where You Run Up a Mountain for 50 Miles
feedItems.content: A cadre of hard-core endurance athletes are embracing skyrunning, which focuses on how high you can run instead of how far.
feedItems.contentSnippet: A cadre of hard-core endurance athletes are embracing skyrunning, which focuses on how high you can run instead of how far.

feedItems.title: News Quiz for April 22, 2023
feedItems.content: Test your knowledge of the week’s events as reported in The Wall Street Journal.
feedItems.contentSnippet: Test your knowledge of the week’s events as reported in The Wall Street Journal.

feedItems.title: Americans Escaping Pricey Cities Bring Higher Inflation With Them
feedItems.content: Inflation in some warm-weather metro areas is more than 2 percentage points higher than the national rate.
feedItems.contentSnippet: Inflation in some warm-weather metro areas is more than 2 percentage points higher than the national rate.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In standoff of ceiling'd debt, the fair
Treasury's trade, warped beyond compare;
A tussle waged on fields of coin,
Such strife, where peace finds no entwine.

From yon face of cities, costly bred,
Americans seek humbled stead;
Their dwellings seized, inflating sum
Though ere shelter, fate's pendulum.

Behold, the rise of steeds electric,
Unearth wealth of mines prolific;
Aye, to a height unseen in waves,
This trove o'er mining deals engraved.

feedItems.title: Debt-Ceiling Standoff Warps Treasury Trading
feedItems.content: The divergence between one-month and three-month bills is the largest on record.
feedItems.contentSnippet: The divergence between one-month and three-month bills is the largest on record.

feedItems.title: Americans Escaping Pricey Cities Bring Higher Housing Costs, Inflation With Them
feedItems.content: Inflation in some warm-weather metro areas is more than 2 percentage points higher than the national rate.
feedItems.contentSnippet: Inflation in some warm-weather metro areas is more than 2 percentage points higher than the national rate.

feedItems.title: Rise of EVs Drives Mining Deals to Decade High
feedItems.content: Mining companies are back at the deals table as they battle for control of commodities essential for making electric cars and renewable-energy infrastructure.
feedItems.contentSnippet: Mining companies are back at the deals table as they battle for control of commodities essential for making electric cars and renewable-energy infrastructure.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Of chill and frost in border lands,
Where Europe's heart meets Russia's hands,

Goats huddle close, a bridge despair.

In fleeting hours, with sparks alight,
Musk sets the world to risks untold,
Like dogs who chase a hare.

Down, dismal fate for banks and gold,
Eleven torches dimmed and cold,
A snail's retreat in western lands unfold.

feedItems.title: Chill Settles In at a Europe-Russia Border Crossing
feedItems.content: High above the Arctic Circle, Norway maintains frosty relations with Moscow, even as most other countries in Europe have closed their doors to most Russians since the invasion of Ukraine.
feedItems.contentSnippet: High above the Arctic Circle, Norway maintains frosty relations with Moscow, even as most other countries in Europe have closed their doors to most Russians since the invasion of Ukraine.

feedItems.title: In 24 Hours, Musk Reignited His Reputation for Risk
feedItems.content: The billionaire entrepreneur had a dramatic week with moves at Twitter, Tesla and SpaceX.
feedItems.contentSnippet: The billionaire entrepreneur had a dramatic week with moves at Twitter, Tesla and SpaceX.

feedItems.title: Moody's Downgrades 11 Regional Banks, Including Zions, U.S. Bank, Western Alliance
feedItems.content: The recent failures of Silicon Valley Bank and Signature have focused attention on regional lenders’ weaknesses.
feedItems.contentSnippet: The recent failures of Silicon Valley Bank and Signature have focused attention on regional lenders’ weaknesses.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In the hall of the snack-gods, where Pepsi doth reign,
A new diet they've chosen, in Norse lands to gain.
From the oceans of pop, and the mountains of chips,
Their whispers unleashed, like the sea at the ship.

Yet within the vast forges, a healthy wave swells,
With more potato harvest, their warriors compelled.
In the mead halls of commerce, the trickster god chuckles,
As feasting and guzzling, add to their muscles.

'Tis said that the sounds, which quaver the air,
Hold more weight in discourse, than e'er one would bear.
Like the calm 'fore the storm, our hesitations ring,
In Odin's grand saga, a song we hear sing.

feedItems.title: Pepsi's New Diet: More Chips and Soda
feedItems.content: If people are going to eat junk food anyway, the company figures it should include less salt, fat and sugar.
feedItems.contentSnippet: If people are going to eat junk food anyway, the company figures it should include less salt, fat and sugar.

feedItems.title: Pepsi's New Healthy Diet: More Potato Chips and Soda
feedItems.content: If people are going to eat junk food anyway, the company figures it should include less salt, fat and sugar.
feedItems.contentSnippet: If people are going to eat junk food anyway, the company figures it should include less salt, fat and sugar.

feedItems.title: Our Sounds of Hesitation Are More Than Filler
feedItems.content: Equivalents of ‘um’ and ‘uh’ appear in most languages, suggesting that such ‘filled pauses’ help us to communicate.
feedItems.contentSnippet: Equivalents of ‘um’ and ‘uh’ appear in most languages, suggesting that such ‘filled pauses’ help us to communicate.
